intro: Taccarum variabile subvar. primum, commonly known as the variable taccarum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
